sense.name: a specific motion picture, a movie
sense.commentary: FILM[+artifact][+opus][+movie][+drama/+comedy/+action/+documentary] [+genre][+artistic][+cinema] Note: refers to the art form of cinema, not to the physical medium of recording (see Sense 2)
sense.examples: The studio is shooting that film on location in Hawaii. That film is still showing in theaters and is not yet out on DVD. Mary watched a good horror film on TV last night. John's father is a famous film critic. His books are very difficult to translate well into film. (into the artistic form, not the physical medium) The article was a critical overview of feminist writing on film. It is one of the most dramatic scenes after captured on film. (refers to the art form, not the physical medium)

sense.name: the photosensitive material used in photography or cinema, celluloid
sense.examples: I have two rolls of film left. The beating incident was captured on film. (refers to the physical medium the event was recorded on) This is an old 35 millimeter film projector.

sense.name: a thin coating of material on the surface of something
sense.examples: The workmen had a film of perspiration over their skin as they labored under the hot sun. A thin film of ice had formed over the pond. There was a film of cream on the top of Mary's coffee.

sense.name: a thin, usually plastic, sheet that serves as a layer or a wrapper
sense.examples: The wrapping paper was an interesting shiny silver film. Mylar is a thin, polyester film, both strong and flexible.
